0:
Joining us in this week’s episode is Multi-faceted creative, Hanaa Abdel-Khalek (@hananithink). If you’re someone that finds themselves trying to juggle many projects or passions at once, this episode is going to be really helpful for you. We discuss the importance of focus in your work and passions and why it’s important to cut out the noise. We also explore Hanan’s many roles as a multi-faceted creative - being a journalist, jewellery designer, podcaster, ethical/sustainable solution consultant and more. We also discuss Hanan’s accessories brand that she, among many things, utilises to explore her creative side and showcase her Egyptian roots. Her brand @youngnevertiti (young·never·ti·ti) is an Egyptian meets Western Pop art accessories brand, which apart from offering amazing jewellery pieces, acts as a creative outlet for Hanan. 
Click the link in our bio to listen into the interview .
.
.
.
.

4:
Podcast Episode 07 // Joining us in this weeks episode, is the young and inspiring fashion entrepreneur, Co-Founder of the iconic Modest Fashion Weeks, Franka Soeria, who sits down with us to chat about her journey setting up Think Fashion & Modest Fashion Weeks with her co-founder Ozlem Sahin, the lessons she’s learnt through some of her most difficult struggles & failures, and her key advice and insights for aspiring female entrepreneurs. 
Click the link in our bio to listen in on our interview with Franka

Apart from being a successful Founder, Franka is also a global fashion consultant, adviser to several government bodies, and writer. Franka is also the founder of @markamarieofficial

For those that may not know, Modest Fashion Week is regarded as the global event of modest fashion, having launched 5 international Modest Fashion Weeks, across Istanbul, London, Jakarta, and Dubai, with a 6th instalment set for December 2019 in Amsterdam. To register and attend Amsterdam Modest Fashion Week 2019, visit the link - https://www.modestfashionweeks.com/en/register/  or click the link in the @modestfashionweeks
.
.

7:
Ep. 06 - In this weeks podcast episode where joined with @zahraa_hberro. Working as an Accountant by day and blogger by night, Zahraa is a prime example of a determined hustler at work, pursuing her passion for blogging & helping inspire other Muslim woman through her platform online in the process .
Zahraa goes into detail with us about her experiences as a content creator and ambassador, how she got started on her journey, the importance of staying true to yourself and blocking out the noise of others trying to bring you down, to stay committed to your passion and your purpose. ----------------------
🔘Click the link in our bio to tune into our interview wth Zahraa
----------------------
As a digital content creator who works with brands regularly, Zahraa challenges the notion that you need hundreds of thousands of followers, or even tens of thousands of followers before you can start working with brands and start to really have an impact. 
Through hard work and determination, Zahraa was able to create connects and work with brands with as little as a couple fo thousand followers. The take away being the need to focus on the quality of your content, rather than the numbers. 
Zahraa takes us through her process on how she did this and how you can also apply this to your own personal brand or business.

Zahraa’s story really highlights the potential for Muslim woman to pursue what they love without limitations, as she works to inspire Muslim women that anything is possible when you put your mind to it and want it bad enough.
.
.
.
.

8:
⚠️PODCAST EPISODE ALERT⚠️⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Get ready, because in this weeks episode you’re in for a real treat, with our guest Hiba Balfaqih (@hibabalfaqih), psychologist, ShEO, serial entrepreneur and coach. Packed full of tactical, actionable steps and hacks that you can implement today, this episode is not one to miss!⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
____________________________________________⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Hiba was kind enough to invite us to her studio where we chat about her life in the lead up to her becoming one of the UAE’s most recognised and highly regarded physiologists and coaches, how she & why she set up her businesses, her podcast and how she is keeping it real and authentic by promoting genuine conversations, and the steps she’s taken to living her life on her own terms.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
In an incredibly genuine and transparent interview, Hiba runs us through how after the loss of two family members and a diagnosis with a chronic disease, Hiba decided to change her life and live it on her own terms.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
____________________________________________⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ She is the ShEO, of The Start Up Factory, a one stop shop for all business needs, focusing on helping the average person get all the knowledge and support they need to start a business.⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
____________________________________________⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
She is also the co-founder of The Smash Room, a space offering people the chance to vent their pent up rage and anger by demolishing things using their weapon of choice, such as a baseball bat, in a safe and controlled environment. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
